title: Biondi 2016 Outis Rosso  (Etna)
description: This fragrant, exquisite red has captivating scents of wild red berry, rose petal, white pepper and menthol and a smoky mineral note. The linear, racy palate is all about finesse, delivering flavors of strawberry, red raspberry, star anise, crushed mint and graphite. It's ethereally elegant and well balanced, with vibrant acidity and polished tannins. It's not for everyone, but lovers of finesse will be in ecstasy. Drink through 2028.

title: Barão de Vilar 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: The structured tannins of this wine shine through the powerful fruits, holding the promise of excellent aging. It is a firm style of wine that is lifted by vibrant fruit flavors. Opulent, bold and ripe, drink from 2028.

title: Billecart-Salmon 2006 Cuvée Nicolas François Brut  (Champagne)
description: Named after the founder of the house, Nicolas François Billecart (who married Elisabeth Salmon), this wine is now at its peak. It is poised between fresh apple fruits and broader, riper maturity. This balance gives a ripe wine hinting at toast and almonds while still with a dry aftertaste. Drink now, although in 2019 it will be even better.

title: Domaine Serene 2016 Evenstad Reserve Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)
description: This is one of the finest Evenstad Reserves to date, bringing a stunningly good mix of tree fruits nuanced by barrel flavors of butterscotch and toasted hazelnut. It all leads into a sappy, cinnamon-inflected finish that lingers gracefully and promises to age well through 2025.

title: Lima Smith 2016 Tecedeiras Vintage  (Port)
description: While the wine is floral, its perfumed fruits are seriously balanced by the dark and ripe tannins. It has a strongly mineral edge that goes with great black-currant fruit that give an edge of freshness to this otherwise dark, powerful wine. Drink from 2027.

title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a jammy, ripe and deeply rich wine. Its firm tannins are fully integrated with the powerful black fruits to give a wine with great potential longevity. The end has an almost fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2027.

title: Domaine Divio 2016 Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: A bright aroma of raspberry jam underscores a core of wet rock. There's a light saline note of oyster shell on the palate, with well-rounded flavors of rich cherry and chocolate that extend through the finish. Though it may sound like an odd mix, this is flat-out delicious.

title: Archery Summit 2015 Looney Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: This nonestate vineyard allows the winery to play with outstanding grapes from this exceptional AVA. Well-proportioned and bursting with details of nutmeg, cinnamon and red licorice, the Looney enchants with a supple core of black cherry fruit, chocolate and espresso.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 Scharzhofberger Auslese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Hints of sun-kissed honeydew and white peach are inviting on the nose of this delicate, sweet Riesling. The palate is rich and fruity, offering intensely concentrated stone-fruit and tangerine flavors marked by a salty, mineral tang that lingers on the finish. It's lovely already, balanced by sprightly acidity, but is sure to develop beautifully through 2030.

title: Boffa 2015 Ovello  (Barbaresco)
description: Intense aromas of rose petal, red berry, forest floor and mint emerge from the glass. The juicy palate delivers red cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and white pepper. It's well balanced, with fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2021–2030.

title: Château de Tracy 2015 Haute Densité  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This wine comes from a densely planted vineyard, with nearly 7,000 vines per acre. Low yields and superripe fruit have yielded a concentrated wine, intense with white fruits and acidity. Age this wine until 2019, to let its richness mature.

title: G. H. Mumm NV RSRV Maison Mumm Cuvée 4+5 Brut  (Champagne)
description: This blend brings together all five of the main regions that supply grapes for Mumm Champagnes. It indicates the increased quality from this venerable producer. With a balance between dry acidity and ripe white fruits, it is poised and elegant, ready to drink now.

title: Guastaferro 2013 Primum  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas of new leather, aromatic herb, exotic spice, prune and cocoa follow over to the palate along with cherry, prune and star anise. A backbone of assertive, fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity provides an age-worthy structure, while a tobacco note lingers on the close. Drink 2021–2033.

title: Louis Roederer 2011 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This wine is made from Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs. The well-balanced palate is textured and mineral driven, with a crisp white-fruit flavor that comes together well. This can be enjoyed now, although it will be better from 2020.

title: Martha's Wines 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a balanced wine with both great ripe black fruits and some serious tannins. Its structure and poise between sweetness and a dry edge give this wine fine potential. It is definitely going to age well. Drink from 2028.

title: Mastroberardino 2011 Radici Riserva  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas of exotic spice, mature black-skinned berry, cocoa and sandalwood lead the way. The palate boasts a weightless concentration, doling out mature black cherry, Mediterranean herb, clove and brown pepper. Firm, refined tannins provide seamless support. Drink through 2031.

title: Quinta do Pôpa 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Packed with bold tannins as well as rich fruit, this is a concentrated wine that is coming into balance. The structure of the wine and its foursquare character are both indicators of a long-term future. Drink from 2027.

title: Rozes 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: The wine is beautifully balanced with ripe tannins and powerfully dense fruit. Layers of blackberry fruits are contrasted with the big tannins and perfumed acidity. There is a mineral edge to this powerful wine that will allow it to age very well. Drink from 2028.

title: Spring Mountain Vineyard 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's high-elevation, 225-acre site on Spring Mountain, this is mineral in crushed rock and sanguine characteristics, with a hit of graphite and black licorice. The fruit is subtle, a mix of black currant and plum wrapped in contrasting notes of cedar and mocha. Medium-bodied, it shows structure and elegance.

title: Steindorfer 2015 Cuvée Klaus Beerenauslese Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)
description: Earthy botrytis and a touch of maple syrup spice inform the lusciously rich, honeyed aromas. A spirity strength tingles on the nose. The palate streams across the tongue in generous sweetness, while spirit and spiky acidity counter this and leave you with a very lasting impression of barley sugar. Lemon and caramel are the chief markers that echo long after the last sip.
